name: Mehmet Engin Tozal
content: Mehmet Engin Tozal - Home Home Teaching Research Service Grants Publications Students Contact Short Biography I am a Francis Patrick Clark/BORSF Endowed Associate Professor in the School of Computing and Informatics at the University of Louisiana at Lafayette and a member of the Informatics Program. I received my Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Texas at Dallas in 2012. My research primarily focuses on the practical and theoretical aspects of complex systems, data science, and artificial intelligence. I specifically develop novel machine learning and graph-theoretic methods to study and address various challenges in cybersecurity, decision support systems, and health informatics to improve predictive analytics and data-driven decision processes.
